; Thu, 12 Oct 2023 14:25:03 +0800 大熊猫野化放归，都要上啥“培训课”？http://www.infzm.com/contents/258425
;;2023-10-12 13:00:00;
;

;;

;

;;The Giant Panda National Park has beautiful scenery. The picture shows the Liziping area. Photo courtesy of the State Forestry and Grassland Administration;

;

;Driving from the urban area of ​​Dujiangyan, Sichuan, along the winding winding mountain road to the west, after driving for more than an hour, we arrived at the China Giant Panda Conservation Research Institute Center (hereinafter referred to as "Panda Center") Wolong Hetaoping Base. The climate here is cool, rainy and humid, and it is located in the natural living environment of giant pandas. It is very suitable for wild training and captive breeding of giant pandas.

;

;The reintroduction of captive giant pandas into the wild is a key technology pioneered by the Panda Center, which is mainly divided into the stages of reintroduction training, release and monitoring. Over the years, generations of scientific researchers have devoted a lot of effort to establish a complete technical system for giant panda wild training and reintroduction monitoring, which has achieved good results in practice.

;

;Why should giant pandas be reintroduced into the wild? What significance does this have for the protection of the giant panda population? From captivity to release, what "training courses" do giant pandas need to take? Recently, reporters conducted on-site visits.

;

;;;

;;Researchers conduct a health check-up on a giant panda cub. Photo by He Shengshan;

;

;;Reintroduction into the wild is an important means to rehabilitate and rebuild the wild giant panda population;

;

;The mountains and forests are green and the streams are trickling. In the rewilding training area of ​​​​Hetaoping Base, except for a path that the staff walked up and down the mountain, there are almost no traces of human activities, and the original ecology is preserved. In order not to disturb the silence, the reporter turned his cell phone to silent and walked in quietly.

;

;In the dense jungle, giant panda "Bosi" and his cub are sleeping soundly. Not far away, keepers in "panda suits" were using this time to clean the pens and replenish fresh bamboo.

;

;"In order to mask the human smell, the 'panda suit' is sprayed with extracts of panda feces and urine." He Shengshan, director of the Field Research Animal Management Department of the Hetaoping Base, told reporters that unlike captive giant pandas, the The breeders are close to and dependent on them, and the breeders trained in the wild must remain "invisible" at all times.

;

;Reintroduction into the wild is an important means to rehabilitate and rebuild the wild population of giant pandas, and is of great significance to the protection of giant pandas.

;

;In recent years, my country has vigorously implemented natural forest protection, wildlife protection projects and the construction of giant panda national parks to protect giant pandas and their habitats, with remarkable results. The results of the fourth national giant panda survey show that the number of wild giant pandas has increased from 1,114 in the 1970s and 1980s to 1,864, distributed in Qinling, Minshan, Qionglai Mountain, Daxiangling, Xiaoxiangling, Liangshan, etc. Six major mountain systems.

;

;However, natural geographical barriers isolate these wild giant pandas in six major mountain systems, and human activities have divided these six major habitat populations into small local populations that cannot interact with each other. "Habitat fragmentation has resulted in the inability of genetic exchange between isolated populations, reducing the genetic diversity of small local populations and accelerating the disappearance of endangered small populations," said Wu Daifu, director of the Hetaoping base.

;

;To save a species, the integrity and stability of the community in which it is located and the genetic diversity within the species must be protected. "Currently, the main measures taken to protect giant pandas in our country are in-situ protection and ex-situ protection." Wu Daifu said that the connection point between the two methods is to release giant pandas bred in captivity after rewilding training. Return to small endangered populations in the wild, thereby improving their genetic diversity, reducing the risk of extinction, and reviving the wild giant panda population.

;

;As global breeding problems such as difficulty in mating and conceiving and raising young to survive have been overcome, artificial breeding of giant pandas has achieved fruitful results, and the captive giant panda population has achieved self-sustainment. In 2003, the Panda Center launched the training and reintroduction of captive-bred giant pandas into the wild.

;

;In April 2006, the male sub-adult giant panda "Xiang Xiang" was released into the wild after independent rewilding training. However, less than a year later, workers found its body in the snow. After analysis and judgment, "Xiangxiang" fell from a height and was seriously injured and died during a fight with a wild giant panda for territory and food.

;

;The Panda Center summarized the failed rewilding case of "Xiang Xiang" and believed that maybe it was the lack of suitable learning objects that led to the lack of survival ability of "Xiang Xiang" in the wild; maybe it was because the population in the reintroduction area was saturated, and "Xiang Xiang" was not able to survive in the wild. "Lack of enough living space; the competition for territory and mates among adult male giant pandas in the wild is extremely fierce. "Xiangxiang" may not have enough fighting experience and cannot resist.

;

;Sum up experience and make persistent efforts. In 2010, with the stable growth of the captive giant panda population, the Panda Center launched the second phase of the captive giant panda rewilding training project, and proposed for the first time a new rewilding training method of "mother animals raising cubs".

;

;;;

;;The giant panda "Qin Xin" was released into the wild. Photo by He Haiyang;

;

;;Helping giant panda cubs learn wild survival skills as soon as they are born;

;

;“At 1:16 in the morning, the cub screamed, "The mother lay on her side to protect her cub" "At 4:53 am, the mother adjusted her sleeping position to protect her cub" "At 8 am, the mother ate 9 bamboos in the morning and drank water twice. The cub screamed loudly and defecated once, but there were no abnormalities." ...In the monitoring room of the Hetaoping base, the work log of the keepers records in detail the daily activities of the giant panda "Hui Hui" and her newborn cubs.

;

;Currently, there are 4 giant panda cubs in the first stage of rewilding training at the Hetaoping Base: "Zhichun Zai" and "Bosi Zai" who are over 1 years old, and two newborn cubs . "All organs of newly born giant panda cubs are not fully developed. We must always pay attention to them and conduct video surveillance around the clock, and take timely measures if any abnormality occurs," said breeder Zhang Dalei.

;

;According to the growth and behavioral development characteristics of giant pandas, rewilding training is divided into two stages. From birth to about 1 year old, in a small training circle of about 2,000 square meters, the cubs eat breast milk. ; From about 1 year old to before release, in a large training circle of 200,000-300,000 square meters, the cubs gradually learn to eat bamboo independently. The large-scale training enclosure is located in the wild habitat environment of giant pandas, where there are tall trees, dense bamboo forests and complex terrain, in a completely natural state.

;

;Based on long-term practice and research, the Panda Center creatively implements "mother animals raising cubs" training. "From birth, the cubs live with their mothers and gradually learn survival skills such as foraging for food, finding water sources, and avoiding natural enemies in nature. In the past, breeders could not teach pandas to climb trees in a few days. Now panda mothers use their mouths to climb trees. Just push the baby up the tree, and the panda baby will learn to climb the tree twice." He Shengshan said that giant pandas can be released into the wild only after completing a series of training and undergoing expert evaluation. "At this time, two or three-year-old pandas will learn to climb trees. Giant pandas are in the post-weaning and pre-adult stage, and as sub-adults, it is easier to integrate into the wild giant panda population."

;

;The selection of female animals is very particular. "It is best for the mother animal to be a multi-parous giant panda with experience in wild life, or an individual with strong ability to raise young." He Shengshan said that at the same time, the body of the mother animal must be kept in good health, and factors such as age and genetic background must also be considered.

;

;In order to avoid "imprinting behavior" in giant panda cubs, the impact of human activities must be minimized. "Every time the female panda is fed food, the keeper will put on a 'panda suit' to prevent the cubs from becoming dependent on humans." Zhang Dalei said that pandas should be made to avoid humans as soon as they sense humans instead of actively approaching them. Only then can they return to the jungle smoothly.

;

;In addition to feeding food, cleaning the enclosures, etc., keepers are also responsible for observing and recording the growth, development and behavioral performance of giant pandas, such as the time of first walking, first climbing, first eating bamboo, etc. Since 2012, Zhang Dalei has raised 7 giant pandas for rewilding training. "Although the work is hard and tiring, as long as they return to the wild and live a healthy life, I will feel a sense of accomplishment."

;

;Accompanying giant pandas all year round is an enviable job, but it also contains risks and challenges that few people know about.

;

;In summer, mudslides often occur in the mountains, and the wild training circle is often put to the test. "The mudslide that occurred on August 20, 2019, was less than 100 meters away from the cabin where we were resting. The situation at that time was very thrilling." He Shengshan still has lingering fears. Encountering wild animals in the wild is also common. "Wild boars, snakes, etc. are often encountered in the mountains. Only by accumulating rich experience and being fully prepared can we avoid danger again and again," He Shengshan said. Now, he and his colleagues always make preventive plans in advance, bring enough supplies before going up the mountain, and carry satellite phones with them to ensure smooth communication.

;

;Researcher Wei Hua almost lost his life while training giant pandas in the wild. In December 2016, the cub "Baxi" who was trained in Tiantai Mountain was close to the age of release, but no sign of "Baxi" was found for two consecutive days. Wei Hua and his colleagues were very worried and entered the training circle to search, but found no trace of him. Thinking of being attacked and seriously injured by the giant panda mother "Ximei" who was eager to protect her cubs. Even so, Wei Hua still believes: "'Ximei' biting me shows that it is wild and maternal. This is exactly the goal we pursue when releasing giant pandas into the wild."

;

;;

;

;;Giant panda mother teaches her cub to climb a tree. Photo by Xue Yubin;

;

;;Carry out the reintroduction of giant pandas in an orderly manner to improve the genetic diversity of small populations;

;

;After giant panda rewilding training, how to determine Release back into the habitat?

;

;Xie Hao, senior engineer of the Investigation and Monitoring Department of the Panda Center, said that scientific researchers will comprehensively consider various factors such as suitable habitat quality, area, staple food bamboo biomass, and genetic background of released giant pandas to determine the release site. . In 2018, giant pandas "Qin Xin" and "Little Walnut" were released into the Longxi Hongkou National Nature Reserve in Dujiangyan City, located in the Minshan Mountains, after undergoing wild training and scientific evaluation.

;

;How to monitor the survival status of giant pandas after they are released?

;

;Xie Hao said that when giant pandas are released, they will be put on an electronic collar that can be tracked and monitored, and their movement trajectory, health status and other information will be tracked through satellite signals. "However, the collar It will fall off in about a year and a half, and long-term tracking and monitoring cannot be carried out. We must rely on infrared cameras, feces sampling and other methods to collect more data."

;

;"Wherever the giant panda is, we will follow it." Xie Hao He said that the monitoring team members searched for giant panda feces in the deep mountains and old forests, recorded relevant detailed information, and analyzed the giant pandas' gender, age, population, and genetic relationships by extracting DNA. "In the mountains and valleys, we often walk for more than half a month, resting wherever we catch up at night. Sometimes we can't keep up with food supplies, and we have to go hungry."

;

;November 2021, Dujiangyan During field monitoring, staff of the city's state-owned forest farm captured images of wild giant pandas through infrared cameras, which were suspected to be giant pandas released in 2018. A team of experts went to the site to inspect and collect fecal samples for further testing. Through the DNA extracted from it, it was determined that this female giant panda over 5 years old was the giant panda "Little Walnut" released in 2018.

;

;;;

;;Researchers use radio equipment to track and monitor the movements of giant pandas. Photo courtesy of China Giant Panda Conservation and Research Center;

;

;Zhang Mingchun, deputy director of the Wild Ecology Research Office of the Panda Center, was excited when he saw the image of "Little Walnut", "This giant panda has a round body and a good mental state." Normal and living in good condition in the wild. When the DNA identification results confirmed that it was indeed 'Little Walnut', the rewilding training team was very excited. This showed that the rewilding training of 'Little Walnut' for more than two years was successful. I hope it can be It thrives in the wild, and we look forward to finding a suitable husband, breeding offspring, and bringing us more surprises!"

;

;So far, the Panda Center has released 11 captive-bred giant pandas, and 9 are still alive. , 7 of which were successfully integrated into the wild population of the Xiaoxiangling Mountain System that are at risk of extinction, and 2 were successfully integrated into the wild population of the Minshan Mountain System. Among the released giant pandas, 1 male and 4 females, a total of 5, are over 6 years old and are in the prime stage of breeding. "Only by releasing giant pandas into the wild population and breeding offspring can we achieve the goal of expanding the wild population. But finding clear evidence that the released giant pandas have offspring requires patience and time," Wu Daifu said.

;

;Currently, our country is building an integrated sky, air and ground monitoring system for national parks. "We take this as an opportunity to add cameras, infrared cameras and other monitoring equipment in the areas where giant pandas are released into the wild to improve large-space monitoring capabilities." said Yang Jian, director of the Investigation and Monitoring Department of the Panda Center. At the same time, we will strengthen the research and development of collars. Efforts are made to improve battery life, improve positioning accuracy, and realize real-time transmission of recordings to understand the wild movements of giant pandas and other wild survival information.

;

;"We will evaluate genetic contributions through dynamic monitoring of the population." Yang Jian said that through technologies such as "cat face recognition" and DNA individual identification, we will use technologies such as "cat face recognition" and DNA individual recognition to analyze giant pandas' kinship, age structure and genetic level. We will carry out dynamic monitoring, establish a database of regional population size, structure and geographical distribution, and verify whether the released individuals are breeding offspring.

;

;Wu Daifu said that within the scope of the Giant Panda National Park, we will analyze the factors limiting the recovery of small local endangered populations from aspects such as genetic diversity, population dynamics, community characteristics, and human interference, and scientifically formulate plans. , carry out the reintroduction of giant pandas in an orderly manner and improve the genetic diversity of small populations.同时，通过在生态廊道开展放归，增强种群间的基因连通性，为实现大熊猫种群的野外复壮提供关键支撑。

;

;目前，大熊猫野化培训梯队已经建立，未来每年将有培训合格的大熊猫个体放归野外，并努力复壮大熊猫小种群。 “我们将加快大熊猫野化培训、放归、监测等关键技术的创新和推广应用，力争每年放归大熊猫3至6只，并通过引种加大野生大熊猫濒危小种群资源保护，逐步建立野生大熊猫遗传种质资源库，实现圈养种群与野生种群基因双向交流。”吴代福说。

;

;On October 7, 2023, Gaza City, Palestinian militants fired rockets at Israel ;(Xinhua News Agency/Photo);

;

;Starting from October 7, 2023, the Palestinian resistance organization Hamas launched an attack on Israel in the border area between Palestine and Israel. Multiple cities launched compound sneak attacks, not only launching a large number of rockets but also conducting violent ground attacks. According to current statistics, at least 700 Israelis have been killed in Hamas attacks. This is the deadliest war between Israeli military and civilians since the Yom Kippur War in 1973.

;

;Israeli Prime Minister Netanyahu promised the people "terrible revenge" on Hamas and declared a state of war. This was Israel's first time in 50 years since the end of the Yom Kippur War in 1973. declared a state of war.

;

;Although this attack happened suddenly, there should be many clues to follow before such a large-scale attack. Why did Israel, which has Mossad, known as the most efficient intelligence agency in the world, not Can we give early warning?

;

;Before discussing this issue, we first need to understand that the intelligence work in the Palestinian-Israeli-controlled areas is positioned as domestic security business in Israel, so the main responsible agency is not the famous Mossad (;Intelligence and Secret Service;), but the Shin Bet (;National Security Agency;).

;

;The Shin Bet's past work in the Gaza Strip has always been considered low-key and effective. For example, in "Operation Green Prince", they successfully instigated the rebellion of the son of Hamas senior Hassan Yusuf. Mosab Hassan Yusuf, for more than ten years since 1996, has obtained a large amount of intelligence from the core decision-making levels of the Hamas organization through him.

;

;The reason why Israel assigns the main intelligence work in the Palestinian-Israeli region to the Shin Bet is actually because there are frequent personnel exchanges between the two places, so there are many operations and inspections that require the cooperation of the police department, and Mossad Mainly responsible for external intelligence and covert operations, its personnel have less cooperation with local police forces, which is not conducive to seamless connection. In addition to internal counter-intelligence and anti-terrorism work, the Shin Bet also has security and protection work for dignitaries and important departments. It is closely connected with the police department, which is obviously more conducive to its work.

;

;So if we really want to hold the responsibility for the poor response to this Hamas raid, the Shin Bet cannot escape the blame, but in the final analysis, this incident also exposed the structural failure of the Israeli military and police intelligence and security system. .

;

;According to information provided to me by some insiders, there are several main reasons for Israel’s ineffective response this time:

;

;The first is Israel’s constitutional crisis starting in 2022, which has led to military The police intelligence and security system is in panic. The judicial reforms carried out by the right-wing government led by Netanyahu may have shaken the foundation of Israel's national unity, causing experienced intelligence personnel and military police to retire early and emigrate overseas. The morale of those in office has also inevitably been low, weakening the country. overall combat capability.

;

;Secondly, the internal security situation in Israel has been severe in the past year or so. The vendettas and gun battles between Arab gangs on the streets have seriously affected Israel’s social security. Organized crime investigation.

;

;There are also technical reasons. In recent years, the Shin Bet and the police have tended to rely more on signal intelligence and technical investigation. Due to their extensive electronic monitoring and aerial reconnaissance operations, as well as big data artificial intelligence intelligence analysis, they can obtain There is far more massive intelligence information than in the past, and automated processing is very fast. Classic manual intelligence acquisition methods like "Operation Green Prince" have become "obsolete" techniques and are no longer the focus of the work.

;

;Although signals intelligence has given Israel an advantage in recent years and is in line with the development direction of intelligence work, Hamas has now found a way to deal with it. Since the Gaza Strip is not large, a large amount of information can be transmitted through primitive person-to-person transmission to avoid signal detection. Since there is no electronic communication, no matter how powerful the monitoring technology is, it is useless.

;

;For Israel, the current results can be said to be caused by a combination of low morale, personnel loss, resource tilt, and opponent evolution. In fact, the complexity of intelligence work far exceeds the imagination of the outside world. Some people use the term "finding a needle in a haystack" to describe it, which is actually not accurate. This type of counter-terrorism intelligence work is more like finding the poisonous needle in a sea full of needles.

;

;The opponent's counterintelligence work is not limited to keeping secrets. At the same time, it will also release a large amount of true and false threat information to confuse the public, just like the shepherd boy who keeps shouting "wolf is coming", leaving people at a loss as to what to do. Israel suffered heavy losses this time, and of course the intelligence and security agencies must be held accountable. However, from a professional perspective, the confrontation between intelligence and counterintelligence has never stopped. Signal intelligence obtained through network penetration, artificial intelligence, and big data analysis is not the only method for future military and counter-terrorism. Only through multi-method reconnaissance and multi-dimensional examination can the negative impact of the fog of war be reduced.
